etymology.description: 日 “sun” + 丂 + 彡 — rays of the sun over a tree branch.
etymology.interpretation: Shows the sun with its rays spreading above a branch, evoking light streaming out and an upward motion. This imagery underlies senses like “bright” and “to raise/lift.”

examples.chinese: 旌旗既昜，鼓角齐鸣。(旌旗既昜，鼓角齊鳴。)
examples.pinyin: Jīngqí jì yáng, gǔjiǎo qí míng.
examples.english: Once the banners are raised, horns and drums sound together.

examples.chinese: 东山初日既昜，雾气渐散。(東山初日既昜，霧氣漸散。)
examples.pinyin: Dōngshān chūrì jì yáng, wùqì jiàn sàn.
examples.english: As the first sun over the eastern hills brightens, the mist gradually disperses.

examples.chinese: 清晨日色昜，行人早起。(清晨日色昜，行人早起。)
examples.pinyin: Qīngchén rìsè yáng, xíngrén zǎo qǐ.
examples.english: At dawn the sunlight is bright, and travelers rise early.
